Description: Document Type: Contract instructions <br> Title: accompaniment of the professional transition @ EPFL <br> REFERENCE NUMBER: 2021 / S 223-588321 <br> Contract Type: Services <br> Description: EPFL today has more than 350 laboratories and research groups, all at the forefront of science and technology. Each year, during the retirement of the responsible professor, a number of laboratory are closed. Human resources have defined a common process related to the restructuring and closures of these units and laboratories. Impacted employees (ES) are informed (ES) 24 months before closing. In case of unplanned departure, a six-month notification period is planned. These units are mainly made up of administrative, technical and scientific collaborators. <br> The TM (Talent Management) unit accompanies the employees concerned by these closures and / or restructuring in terms of the search strategy, training or other action to facilitate their internal mobility or their external replacement. <br> <br> 79900000 - Miscellaneous Business and Business-Related Services 79600000 - Recruitment Services .... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS AND MALARIA. (THE GLOBAL FUND). Summary: External Quality Assessment for the Office of the Inspector General. Description: Tenders are invited for External Quality Assessment for the Office of the Inspector General    Notices  9.1. All notices between the Parties in connection with the Contract shall be in writing and in English, and delivered by hand, registered mail or e-mail, in accordance with the relevant contact details stated in the Contract.    9.2. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Global Fund in writing of any change in the Service Provider-s contact or address details for notices. The Global Fund may rely conclusively on, and shall incur no liability in respect of any action taken upon, any notice, consent, request, instruction or other instrument believed in good faith to be genuine or to be signed by an authorized representative of the Service Provider.    Evaluation, Acceptance or Rejection  12.1. To Confirm the Continued Adequacy of the Service and/or Compliance with the Required Standards, the Service Provider shall Allow the Global Fund to Evaluate, Test and/or Inspect the Service and/or Related Goods Regularly or Randomly during Normal Business Hours on Reasonable Notice. The Service Provider and/or its Subcontractors shall Furnish All Reasonable Facilities and Assistance, including Access to Drawing and Production Data, as Applicable, and Other Relevant Documents at No Cost to the Global Fund. Details of the Evaluation, Tests and/or Inspection that the Global Fund Requires, if There are Any, are to be Specified in the Contract.    12.2. The Global Fund may Reject the Services and/or Related Goods, or Any Part Thereof, if it is Evaluated to be Inadequate or not Conforming to the Specifications Provided in the Contract. The Global Fund may Ask the Service Provider to Either Rectify or Modify/Improve the Services and/or Related Goods, or Any Part Thereof, as Necessary and at No Cost to the Global Fund, to Meet the Required Standard.    12.3. The Service Provider-S Consent to the Evaluation and/or Testing of the Services, or Inspection of the Related Goods, or Any Part Thereof, shall not Release the Service Provider from its Warranties and Other Obligations under the Contract. Tender Value: 0. Published Date: 2021-04-30. Closing Date: 2021-05-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (GFFATM)
